caption: Very beautiful building! We didn’t get online tickets as we heard that the opera’s access is not always open for visitors. We bought our tickets from the ticket desk at the reception and everything was very quick. No queue no waiting. Once inside, the architecture is breathtaking! Looks like a mini (very mini) version of Versailles. Definitely, one of the most beautiful buildings in Paris, both from inside and outside!

The Paris Grand Opera is an absolute masterpiece! From its stunning façade to the opulent interior, every detail exudes elegance and history. The grand staircase is breathtaking, perfect for photos, and the acoustics inside are phenomenal. A must-see, even if you’re not attending a performance—pure magic!

Wowwee! We went just to see the building. The opera showing (or not actually, because they were on strike!), was a modern one and not to our taste, but the building itself is absolutely fabulous! And we're lucky enough to be able to go into the auditorium, because the rehearsal which ought to have been taking place was canceled. But that's only the part of it!  We were booked on a guided tour. With William. I have to tell you that the guided tour was absolutely brilliant. The building is one thing, but the performance YES PERFORMANCE of our tour guide William was worth the money in itself. It was a masterpiece of off-stage theatre and made the whole experience exceptional. He had us entertained from the first minute to the last. Brilliant. I'm not sure whether you can request your tour guide, but if you can, then make a bid for William's tour. Ours was in English, but he speaks several other languages. Being so funny in a language other than your first takes real skill. Bravo!

One of my favorite places in Paris. It's absolutely breathtaking. I purchased the Belle Epoque guided tour, which was very informative. It's great because you get detailed information on the place and afterward you're allowed to stay there to go at your own pace to take pictures. The gift shop has a great assortment of items. A must do!

This is absolutely breathtaking! The architecture, the intricate details, and the history behind every corner left me in astonishment.  The travel guide I used by Neil B. Stones from Amazon helped me appreciate it even more, making the visit smooth and insightful.  Palais Garnier, must see for anyone visiting Paris!

I had never heard of this landmark before I had reached Paris. But it was really unjustified as this is one of the best places to see in the world. It is really 'Gawdy'. But I don't know too many places to view such a place. Decor to every corner is very detailed and extravagant. definitely worth a visit. Takes an hour or 2 to see. Price was not too bad. Not sure if they still do plays here but I would like to see one here. The line was very short. There is a gift shop.
Absolutely beautiful building. Really tall chandeliers with beautiful art work. Great place to take pictures. Was quite busy with other tourists though. Bought tickets on site and had no wait at all.

When I visited, a staff member at the ticket counter asked if I was there to watch the play or just to visit. Due to limited time, I couldn't watch the play. Its grandeur and intricate details, both inside and out, are breathtaking. The opulent interiors, grand staircase, and beautiful chandeliers create a magical atmosphere. A must-visit for anyone who appreciates history, art, and elegance.

It was my first time in such a magnificent place. I arrived on Saturday after lunch, so it wasn’t very crowded. However, within an hour, people began pouring in, and the atmosphere turned quite chaotic. I found myself imagining wearing a different outfit, in another century, on a different occasion, strolling through the corridors, the auditorium, or even the stage, fully immersed in the golden age. This experience felt even more special because I was brought here by people who cherished me deeply. As I envisioned those dimensions and another life, I thought of the person I loved and hoped he thought the same way about me.

Loved taking a tour! Highly recommend! Also if you can, it would probably be best to go on a weekday, we went on a weekend and it was extremely crowded.  Also- quick note: a tour or tickets do not guarantee entrance to the inside of the auditorium. We were able to see it but they are often rehearsing or preparing for a show so be aware you might not be able to see it.

I visited the opera as a museum for the first time. Most of the halls are accessible to visitors. I took an audio guide, it is an interesting story that takes you through the rooms and galleries of the large theater. There are theatrical costumes there. There is an elevator, there are beautiful wide stairs. There is a souvenir shop at the exit from the theater. to get inside. I didn't wait very long on the street. Then inside there is a long queue at the regular ticket office for tickets, or you can buy tickets from a machine without a queue. Everything is clear there, you can choose the language.

There aren’t words enough to describe the magnificent interior. Absolutely the most beautiful building. I believe I’ve ever been in.  It was lots of fun looking at all the beautiful young people dressed up, taking formal photographs on the staircase and what not not to be missed!

Always been on my bucket list to visit this opera house and it doesn’t disappoint. The opera house part is actually quite small and intimate. The hall though is absolutely gorgeous in all its Italian grandeur.

We visited the outside a week earlier then decided to go in.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND getting tickets in advance.  All ticket holders go in first while the rest line up on the ramp. It took about 40 minutes to get in.  Once in, find a ticket kiosk.  The beauty inside is indescribable.  Make sure to visit.

Some fabulous rooms. Some interesting details. Other things, not so much. The tablet tour was unwieldy and I can’t recommend. I would have liked to have known more of the musical aspects of the house as a musician.
It’s so beautiful. A must visit! It’s worth the €15 entry fee. The interior is very luxurious. This is a popular place but it was not too crowded. I’d love to come again to watch a show.

We booked our ticket online to attend an early show on Sunday at 2:30 It was such a lovely experience I recommend to go 45 min earlier to enjoy the venue , roam around and have a glass of champagne before the start of the show. The building is an architectural marvel , admired the details and the whole experience

A stunning landmark in Paris, worth the visit and incredible to look at both inside and out (although currently under renovation at the font of the building). Would highly recommend one of the tours, which we unfortunately missed this visit.

Exquisite, from the moment you step out of the metro station, you’re met with the impressive and imposing building. I recommend purchasing tickets in advance, and I also 100% recommend opting for a guided tour. Our guide was perfect; unfortunately, I don’t remember his name, but he’s a bald man of average height, extremely friendly, very funny, but most importantly, super intelligent and knows the history inside and out, extremely knowledgeable!! An incredible experience.
It was an amazing experience! I really recommend the guided tour after closing. It was quiet, and the Guide was really knowledgeable. I'll definitely visit again when I'm back in Paris!

I was expecting more: we only visited ground and first floor, the other were for groups or private tours. The good part is that you can buy tickets onsite and the queue for people without ticket was shorter than the one with tickets. It is worth (at least once) if you visit Paris.

Absolutely stunning building with a great guided tour via Manatour for inside access to the opera seating itself. The main function hall is more beautiful than Versailles' Hall of Mirrors, which we visited again shortly thereafter.

I thought I had seen everything in Paris, but when I saw the Palais Garnier opera, my eyes felt a blissful feeling of beauty and joy and I experienced something which is beyond words. No picture can describe the beauty this place beholds.

We had advanced tickets and they left about 200 people standing in the pouring rain for at least a half hour after it was suppose to open. I looked around all the old people thinking they will be sick tomorrow. So cruel. We were all soaked to the bone.  The opera was lovely but was not worth being sick the next few days.

Absolutely stunning. It was very busy as it was a Sunday. The shop really could use an upgrade. I was there before and got some great ballet sweatshirts and sweaters but this time there was no supply at all. Quite junky.  The Operation house, is beautiful and the promenade for the intermissions is amazing. Definitely a must see.

This is a must do in Paris, absolutely amazing building inside and out. Took my daughter as she is a massive Phantom fan but stayed for hours just looking at the beautiful scenery, we didn't go on a guided tour and just walked round at our own leisure (didn't see the Phantom though) I would highly recommend

I selected the after hours tour at 17:00, and it was an excellent decision.  You tour this opera house in a small group, which allows you to take beautiful pictures with almost no people blocking your shots.  Our guide was very knowledgeable and his English was perfect.  I definitely recommend picking this tour.

Amazing place to visit. The guides are very nice and helpful. When you enter this place it’s like you are entering another world. A lot of great art work especially on the sealing. Also it’s a great place to take pictures. So when you want to visit come early so you have time to take pictures and enjoy the art.
Beautiful and well located. If you have time on a shopping day to pop in and have a look, I highly recommend it. Book tickets in advance to save time.

I bought a ticket online and got inside without waiting, but there was a huge line of people, who were waiting for tickets. The auditorium was closed on the day of my visit, so keep that in mind, in my opinion it is very impressive, so it would be unfortunate to miss if it was your first time at Garnier. Other areas are interesting and breathtaking too, they also have a very good bookshop. Keep in mind that the crowds are extreme, taking a picture sometimes might seem impossible, but the opera is definitely worth it. Dont skip the library!

Beautiful but not sure I’d visit again unless we were going to the opera.  Very ornate rooms and great stories (Phantom of the Opera). But overall we could have done without this stop.  I’d love to come back and see a show though as I feel like that’s the best way to experience.

A highlight of my trip to Paris. In my opinion the opera house was a must do. The building is just exquisite and more beautiful than the hall of mirrors at Versailles in my opinion. Definitely book tickets online - go for the very first slot and get there early before 9am. The queue was chaotic outside and so long. People were queueing at 9am for like the 11am slot - it was not well organised.  The main room is mostly empty during the 9am slot, and then you get to explore the rest of the opera house. It’s amazing that someone created this masterpiece.

It's all so beautiful and perfect, you can't go to Paris and not visit Palais Garnier. We can see the architecture alive, you can see that all the details were well thought out and made to perfection.  It's very beautiful, I have no words to describe it. I just found it very hot inside because there is no air circulation, but it's very perfect. The camera can't show how beautiful it is

Absolutely stunning. Speechless. This grandiose opera house is a true architectural marvel, with its opulent interiors, stunning chandeliers, and richly decorated ceilings. Walking through the elegant halls and taking in the beauty of the Grand Staircase was like stepping back in time to a more glamorous era. The highlight was definitely the grand auditorium, with its plush red seats and the breathtaking Chagall ceiling.

A must visit place when you are in Paris. Absolument magnifique! Recommended to get tickets online to avoid waiting in queue. It can get crowded inside, so if you want photos with not much people I recommend going early or late in the afternoon.
I would have loved to do the tour but got here too late and the tour was not available by then. It looks absolutely stunning from the  outside and I’m sure it would also look amazing inside
Marvel at the beauty! The students of art majors have free admission to feel the great love of the Palais Garnier for promoting human art civilization!❤️  I love Paris
Gorgeous building with remarkable interior! But like Disneyland now due to so many tourists visiting it even for performances. People are just taking pictures in any corner. That's sad.
